channel.title: U.S. News: Top U.S. News Today | AP News
channel.description: View the latest national news from The Associated Press. Stay tuned in to all of the current events within the U.S. borders and breaking U.S. news stories.

image.title: U.S. News: Top U.S. News Today | AP News

item.title: FDA targets illegal nicotine gummies in new warning letter
item.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Federal regulators on Thursday issued a first-of-a-kind warning to the maker of nicotine gummies, saying the illegal candies pose a growing risk to teenagers and younger children.
item.dc:creator: AP NEWS

item.title: Accuser and star witness testifies at R Kelly trial
item.description: CHICAGO (AP) — A woman who prosecutors say R. Kelly manipulated for sex starting when she was about 14 years old took the witness stand Thursday at Kelly’s child pornography and obstruction of justice trial, becoming the first accuser to testify in the singer’s hometown of Chicago.
item.dc:creator: AP NEWS

item.title: Judge limits privilege defense in AZ Mormon sex abuse case
item.description: An Arizona judge overseeing a high-profile lawsuit accusing the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints of conspiring to cover-up child sex abuse has ruled that the church may not refuse to answer questions or turn over documents under the state’s “clergy-penitent privilege.”
item.dc:creator: AP NEWS

item.title: Graham appeals order to testify in Georgia election probe
item.description: ATLANTA (AP) — U.S. Sen. Lindsey Graham has formally appealed a judge's order requiring him to testify before a special grand jury investigating whether former President Donald Trump and others illegally sought to overturn his 2020 election defeat in Georgia.
item.dc:creator: AP NEWS

item.title: Agent: There was talk of blasting 2 bridges in Whitmer plot
item.description: An FBI agent who was working undercover told jurors Thursday about a stop at a bridge near Michigan Gov. Gretchen Whitmer's vacation home during a night ride by anti-government extremists to continue planning a kidnapping.
item.dc:creator: AP NEWS

item.title: US offers extra monkeypox vaccine doses for gay pride events
item.description: NEW YORK (AP) — The U.S. is setting aside an extra 50,000 doses of monkeypox vaccine for places with upcoming gay pride events, health officials said Thursday. The number of doses sent to each will be based on factors like the size of the event, how many health workers will be available to give shots, and how many of the attendees are considered at highest risk for catching the virus.
item.dc:creator: AP NEWS

item.title: Trio of suits target Florida 'woke' law pushed by DeSantis
item.description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla. (AP) — A trio of lawsuits target a Florida law championed by Republican Gov. Ron DeSantis that restricts race-based conversation and analysis in business and education, the latest filed Thursday by college professors and students claiming it is blatantly unconstitutional.
item.dc:creator: AP NEWS

item.title: GOP questions delays at Evers' licensing agency
item.description: MADISON, Wis. (AP) — Republican lawmakers are raising questions about why the state Department of Safety and Professional Services is taking weeks to issue licenses. The Milwaukee Journal Sentinel reported Thursday that the average wait time for professional licenses is currently 45 days.
item.dc:creator: AP NEWS

item.title: Kentucky Supreme Court denies request to block abortion ban
item.description: FRANKFORT, Ky. (AP) — Kentucky's Supreme Court ruled Thursday that the state's near-total abortion ban will remain in place while it reviews arguments by abortion clinics challenging two state laws.
item.dc:creator: AP NEWS

item.title: Climate bill's unlikely beneficiary: US oil and gas industry
item.description: BILLINGS, Mont. (AP) — The U.S. oil industry hit a legal roadblock in January when a judge struck down a $192 million oil and natural gas lease sale in the Gulf of Mexico over future global warming emissions from burning the fuels.
item.dc:creator: AP NEWS

item.title: Federal study: New climate law to slice carbon pollution 40%
item.description: Clean energy incentives in the new spending package signed this week by President Joe Biden will trim America’s emissions of heat-trapping gases by about 1.1 billion tons (1 billion metric tons) by 2030, a new Department of Energy analysis shows.
item.dc:creator: AP NEWS

item.title: Rushdie's attacker indicted, expected to appear in court
item.description: MAYVILLE, N.Y. (AP) — A grand jury has indicted the man who stabbed Salman Rushdie as the acclaimed author prepared to give a talk in western New York, county prosecutors said Thursday. Hadi Matar, 24, of Fairview, New Jersey, is scheduled to appear on the charges at an afternoon court hearing in Chautauqua County.
item.dc:creator: AP NEWS

item.title: Hong Kong political activists plead guilty amid crackdown
item.description: HONG KONG (AP) — Authorities in Chinese-controlled Hong Kong say 29 out of 47 pro-democracy activists charged with “conspiracy to commit subversion” under a tough National Security Law entered guilty pleas on Thursday, as the Beijing government seeks to further silence opposition voices in the regional financial hub.
item.dc:creator: AP NEWS

item.title: FEMA declares new strategy to engage Native American tribes
item.description: The Federal Emergency Management Agency has developed a new strategy to better engage with with hundreds of Native American tribes as they face climate change-related disasters, the agency announced Thursday.
item.dc:creator: AP NEWS

item.title: US to hold trade talks with Taiwan in new show of support
item.description: HUALIEN, Taiwan (AP) — The U.S. government will hold talks with Taiwan on a wide-ranging trade treaty in a sign of support for the self-ruled island democracy China claims as its own territory. The announcement Thursday comes after Beijing held military drills that included firing missiles into the sea to intimidate Taiwan following this month’s visit by U.S.
item.dc:creator: AP NEWS

item.title: Trump CFO’s plea deal could make him a prosecution witness
item.description: NEW YORK (AP) — Donald Trump’s chief financial officer is expected to plead guilty to tax violations Thursday in a deal that would require him to testify about illicit business practices at the former president's company, two people familiar with the matter told The Associated Press.
item.dc:creator: AP NEWS

item.title: Trump CFO’s plea deal could make him a prosecution witness
item.description: NEW YORK (AP) — Donald Trump’s chief financial officer is expected to plead guilty to tax violations Thursday in a deal that would require him to testify about illicit business practices at the former president's company, two people familiar with the matter told The Associated Press.
item.dc:creator: AP NEWS

item.title: Rosalynn Carter marking 95th birthday with butterflies
item.description: Rosalynn Carter, the second-oldest U.S. first lady ever, turns 95 Thursday on a birthday that will be marked not just with cards and best wishes, but with butterflies. The wife of former President Jimmy Carter , 97, has a fascination with butterflies dating back to childhood, when she was entranced by the colorful insects flitting around her mother's flowers in Plains, Georgia, longtime friend and neighbor Annette Wise said.
item.dc:creator: AP NEWS

item.title: Post-Roe differences surface in GOP over new abortion rules
item.description: MADISON, Wis. (AP) — When the U.S. Supreme Court repealed in June a woman's constitutional right to an abortion, Wisconsin's 1849 law that bans the procedure except when a mother's life is at risk became newly relevant.
item.dc:creator: AP NEWS

item.title: Nevada gov vows to codify order protecting patients into law
item.description: RENO, Nev. (AP) — Nevada Gov. Steve Sisolak said Wednesday that if he wins re-election he would seek to codify in law next legislative session an order he signed that protects in-state abortion providers and out-of-state patients .
item.dc:creator: AP NEWS

item.title: US to hold trade talks with Taiwan in new show of support
item.description: BEIJING (AP) — The U.S. government has announced talks with Taiwan on a trade treaty in a new sign of support for the self-ruled island democracy claimed by China’s ruling Communist Party as part of its territory.
item.dc:creator: AP NEWS

item.title: Trump Org. CFO to plead guilty, testify against company
item.description: NEW YORK (AP) — Donald Trump’s chief financial officer is expected to plead guilty to tax violations Thursday in a deal that would require him to testify about illicit business practices at the former president's company, two people familiar with the matter told The Associated Press.
item.dc:creator: AP NEWS

item.title: Incumbent auditor trails primary challenger in fundraising
item.description: DOVER, Del. (AP) — Delaware’s incumbent state auditor has raised only about half as much in campaign contributions this year as her Democratic primary challenger has, according to campaign finance reports filed this week.
item.dc:creator: AP NEWS

item.title: Missouri man charged with threatening election official
item.description: PHOENIX (AP) — A Missouri man has been indicted for leaving a threatening message on the personal cellphone of the top election official in Arizona's most populous county, federal officials said. The case is the second filed in the past month against people accused of threatening top election officials in the battleground state.
item.dc:creator: AP NEWS

item.title: Alex Jones' lawyer faces disciplinary hearing in Connecticut
item.description: HARTFORD, Conn. (AP) — A lawyer for conspiracy theorist Alex Jones is facing scrutiny from a Connecticut judge, who began hearing testimony Wednesday on whether the lawyer should be disciplined for giving other attorneys for Jones highly sensitive documents, including medical records of relatives of victims of the Sandy Hook Elementary School shooting.
item.dc:creator: AP NEWS
